summary: The Kayla Hamilton Act amends the William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of 2008 to enhance efforts to combat child trafficking. It mandates additional safeguards when placing unaccompanied alien children, including criminal record checks from their home country and examination for gang-related markings. It also prohibits placing children with individuals unlawfully present in the US and requires the Department of Health and Human Services to provide detailed information about placement individuals and their households to the Department of Homeland Security, including background checks.
